intro: Polygala cneorum, commonly known as the Mediterranean milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems. The plant has small, greenish-yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and opposite. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
